sentences_tone.text: Survey Finds College Applications from International Students DownColleges and universities in the U.S. could see a sharp decline in enrollment of international students if initial figures from a survey are an early indicator of what's to come.Nearly 40 percent of responding U.S. institutions are reporting a drop in international student applications, particularly from students in the Middle East, according to initial findings from a survey of 250 schools.
Declines are also reported for students from China and India at both the undergraduate and graduate levels.
